Ed looks longingly at his reflection. Ed Saxon, 45, is a morbid, insecure man. His frustration with his l his sense of humor with an acerbic bite. His early succes publications of his poetry, has given him a professorship University. He is well-read, intelligent, a bit pompous a occasionally condescending. He opens the front door and takes a step outside.
He looks down by his feet and finds the morning paper, wrapped in blue plastic, lying on the doormat. He and goes back inside.

You did the right thing, sir. Ed hangs up. Almost instantly, he sees some lights pass by the window. He looks through the window an police car pull up. He opens the door and watches the off approaches the house. OFFICER STEWART is a youngish patrolman.  He is relaxed,

Yes.  You too. Ed shuts the door. He's a little wired so he sits at his desk and picks up a pile of his students' pap the one on top, marking it with a red pen as he does. He hears a gurgling noise coming quietly from the bathroo
